general_advisory: Prevailing fog condition and gradual increase in temperature may increase the infestation for sucking pest like White fly, Aphids, Jassids & Thirps in vegetables so regular monitor the crop & install yellow sticky trap @ 8/acre. Spraying of pesticides to be done after 3 pm to protect the honey bee.

advisory: Transplanting of 25-30 days old seedlings should be done at a spacing of 20x15 cm, plant 2-3 seedlings per hill for high yielding varieties.
Farmers going for transplanting should apply 35 kg DAP, 20 kg MOP, and 8 kg Urea per acre during last puddling as basal fertilizer. In Zinc deficient soil apply Zinc Sulphate (21%) @ 10 kg/acre.

Foliar spraying of (Tebuconazole + Trifloxystrobin) @ 0.5ml/litre of water along with plantomycin @ 1g/litre of water 5-6 days before transplanting recommended for disease management in nursery & main field.
Monitor the activity of white grub & install light trap to attract the beetles. White grab infestation in groundnut can be minimized by localized application of Chloropyriphous dust recommended.
Need based spraying and drenching with (carbendazim + mancozeb) or (metaloxyl + mancozeb) @ 2gm/lit of water to protect the crop from collar rot, stem rot and tikka disease.
In the initial crop growth stage to control Flea beetle & other defoliaters growth spray Prophenophos @ 2ml/litre of water recommended.
Rouging of MYMV & ULCV infected plants & spraying of Difenthurion 50WP @ 200g/acre or 1g/litre of water is recommended.

Prevailing fog condition and gradual increase in temperature may increase the infestation of aphid. To control aphid need-based spraying of neem oil formulation @ 600ml per acre or Flonicamid @ 60g per acre is recommended.
Need-based spraying of Emamectin benzoate @80gm per acre to reduce the infestation of cabbage weber and Spodoptera litura.
The weather is suitable for application of fertilizer to rabi vegetables which are at 3 to 4 weeks stage.
To prevent from wilting or partial wilting in brinjal and tomato apply Neem or Karanjaa cake and spray (basal + foliar) Tebuconazole fungicide @ 1ml/liter.

Papaya - Install Yellow Sticky trap to trap the vector (Whitefly) of Papaya Leaf Curl Virus. Alternate spraying of Neem oil formulation 1500ppm @ 3ml/lit of water and Flonicamid 50WG @ 0.3g/litre to control whitefly.
Marigold - Spray the Marigold plant with Difenthurion @ 1g/li of water or Abamectin @ 0.75ml/li of water to control the infestation of Thrips, Aphids, Mites, and Leaf Minor.

Animals should be given mineral mixture along with salt regularly and wheat grains, jaggery etc. may be provided @ 10% -20% in the daily ration during the winter season to meet the energy requirement of the animals.
